00044 #include <fstream>
00045 #include <iostream>
00046 #include <string>
00047 #include <cstring>
00048 
00049 #ifdef __cplusplus
00050 extern "C"{
00051 #endif
00052         #include <stdio.h>
00053         #include <string.h>
00054         #include <assert.h>
00055 #ifdef __cplusplus
00056 }
00057 #endif
00058 
00059 using namespace std;
00060 
00061 
00062 class MD5
00063 {
00064 private:
00065     // first, some types:
00066     typedef unsigned       int uint4; // assumes integer is 4 words long
00067     typedef unsigned short int uint2; // assumes short integer is 2 words long
00068     typedef unsigned      char uint1; // assumes char is 1 word long
00069 
00070 public:
00071     // methods for controlled operation:
00072     MD5              ();  // simple initializer
00073     void  update     (uint1 *input, uint4 input_length);
00074     void  update     (istream& stream);
00075     void  update     (FILE *file);
00076     void  update     (ifstream& stream);
00077     void  finalize   ();
00078 
00079     // constructors for special circumstances.  All these constructors finalize
00080     // the MD5 context.
00081     MD5(const string &str);
00082     MD5              (unsigned char *str); // digest string, finalize
00083     MD5              (istream& stream);       // digest stream, finalize
00084     MD5              (FILE *file);            // digest file, close, finalize
00085     MD5              (ifstream& stream);      // digest stream, close, finalize
00086 
00087     // methods to acquire finalized result
00088     unsigned char    *raw_digest ();  // digest as a 16-byte binary array
00089     char *            hex_digest ();  // digest as a 33-byte ascii-hex string
00090     friend ostream&   operator<< (ostream&, MD5 context);
00091 
00092 private:
00093     // the private data:
00094     uint4 state[4];
00095     uint4 count[2];     // number of *bits*, mod 2^64
00096     uint1 buffer[64];   // input buffer
00097     uint1 digest[16];
00098     uint1 finalized;
00099 
00100     // last, the private methods, mostly static:
00101     void init             ();               // called by all constructors
00102     void transform        (uint1 block[64]);  // does the real update work.  Note
00103     // that length is implied to be 64.
00104 
00105     static void encode    (uint1 *dest, uint4 *src, uint4 length);
00106     static void decode    (uint4 *dest, uint1 *src, uint4 length);
00107     static void memcpy    (uint1 *dest, uint1 *src, uint4 length);
00108     static void memset    (uint1 *start, uint1 val, uint4 length);
00109 
00110     static inline uint4  rotate_left (uint4 x, uint4 n);
00111     static inline uint4  F           (uint4 x, uint4 y, uint4 z);
00112     static inline uint4  G           (uint4 x, uint4 y, uint4 z);
00113     static inline uint4  H           (uint4 x, uint4 y, uint4 z);
00114     static inline uint4  I           (uint4 x, uint4 y, uint4 z);
00115     static inline void   FF  (uint4& a, uint4 b, uint4 c, uint4 d, uint4 x,
00116                               uint4 s, uint4 ac);
00117     static inline void   GG  (uint4& a, uint4 b, uint4 c, uint4 d, uint4 x,
00118                               uint4 s, uint4 ac);
00119     static inline void   HH  (uint4& a, uint4 b, uint4 c, uint4 d, uint4 x,
00120                               uint4 s, uint4 ac);
00121     static inline void   II  (uint4& a, uint4 b, uint4 c, uint4 d, uint4 x,
00122                               uint4 s, uint4 ac);
00123 };
